TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit XpsDocumentWriter extends System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter

Docs.summary: Provides methods to write to an XPS document or print queue.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter> has no constructor. To create an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter>, use the static <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument.CreateXpsDocumentWriter%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class or use one of the static <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.CreateXpsDocumentWriter%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> class. The document or the queue that creates the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter> becomes the target to which it writes.
## Examples The following example shows how to create an instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter> class.
:::code language="csharp" source="~/snippets/csharp/System.Windows.Documents/DocumentPaginator/PageSize/XpsSaveHelper.cs" id="Snippetcreatexpsdocumentwriter"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsSave/visualbasic/xpssavehelper.vb" id="Snippetcreatexpsdocumentwriter":::

public: override void CancelAsync();

Docs.summary: Cancels the current operation.
Docs.exception: No asynchronous write operation is in progress.

Docs.summary: Returns a that can write objects to a document or print queue.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument> writes to the same target <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> as the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter> that creates the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument>.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.CreateVisualsCollator%2A> method.

A that represents the default printing preferences for each document.
Docs.summary: Returns a that can write objects with settings to an XPS document or print queue.
Docs.returns: The new that writes elements with settings to the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument> writes to the same target <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> as the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter> that creates the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument>.
This method does not validate or modify the specified `documentPrintTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>. If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and valid for a specified printer.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Write (string documentPath);
.method public hidebysig instance void Write(string documentPath) cil managed
Public Sub Write (documentPath As String)
override this.Write : string -> unit
public: void Write(System::String ^ documentPath);

Docs.param: The path of the source document.
Docs.summary: Synchronously writes a specified XPS document to the target or .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Although the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter> class has a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter> can be one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of multiple documents. This method adds the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements in the source to the set of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements in the target <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter> or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.
This `Write` method reserializes the specified XPS document, which removes all content from the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package> that isn't required to be preserved by the [XML Paper Specification](https://www.ecma-international.org/publications-and-standards/standards/ecma-388/). The reserialization also removes all extensions from the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> markup, including any extended XPS content.
By design, this `Write` method does not raise the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WritingPrintTicketRequired> event.

public: override void Write(System::Windows::Documents::DocumentPaginator ^ documentPaginator);

Docs.summary: Writes synchronously paginated content from a specified to the target or .

MemberSignature.Value: public void Write (string documentPath, System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentNotificationLevel notificationLevel);
.method public hidebysig instance void Write(string documentPath, valuetype System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentNotificationLevel notificationLevel) cil managed
Public Sub Write (documentPath As String, notificationLevel As XpsDocumentNotificationLevel)
override this.Write : string * System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentNotificationLevel -> unit
public: void Write(System::String ^ documentPath, System::Windows::Xps::XpsDocumentNotificationLevel notificationLevel);

Docs.param: The path of the source document.
An indication of whether notification is enabled.
Docs.summary: Writes synchronously a specified XPS document to the target or .

remarks.format:
## Remarks When `notificationLevel` is disabled, the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter> copies the serializedXPS document to the target <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> that created the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter>. When `notificationLevel` is enabled, the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter> first deserializes the document, next reserializes it, and then writes it to the target with progress notifications as each page is output.
Although the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class has a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of multiple documents. This method adds the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements in the source to the sequence of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements in the target <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.
If `notificationLevel` is specified as <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentNotificationLevel.ReceiveNotificationEnabled>, notifications are produced only when the document is serialized, not printed. To receive notifications the document must be reserialized. When a document is reserialized, all content from the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package> that's not required to be preserved by the [XML Paper Specification (XPS)](https://www.ecma-international.org/publications-and-standards/standards/ecma-388/) is removed. The reserialization will also remove all extensions from the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> markup, including any extended XPS content.
If `notificationLevel` is specified as <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentNotificationLevel.ReceiveNotificationDisabled> the document will not be reserialized and any extended content will be preserved, even when printed.
By design this <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.Write%2A> method does not call the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WritingPrintTicketRequired> event.

This method adds a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> to the set.
## Examples The following example shows how to use this method to write to an XPS document.
:::code language="csharp" source="~/snippets/csharp/System.Windows.Documents/DocumentPaginator/PageSize/XpsSaveHelper.cs" id="Snippetwriteasynctoxpswithfixeddocument"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsSave/visualbasic/xpssavehelper.vb" id="Snippetwriteasynctoxpswithfixeddocument":::

public: override void WriteAsync(System::Windows::Documents::FixedDocumentSequence ^ fixedDocumentSequence);

Docs.summary: Writes asynchronously a specified to the target or .

remarks.format:

This method adds a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements to the existing set.
## Examples The following example shows how to use this method to write to an XPS document.

MemberSignature.Value: public void WriteAsync (string documentPath, System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentNotificationLevel notificationLevel);
.method public hidebysig instance void WriteAsync(string documentPath, valuetype System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentNotificationLevel notificationLevel) cil managed
Public Sub WriteAsync (documentPath As String, notificationLevel As XpsDocumentNotificationLevel)
override this.WriteAsync : string * System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentNotificationLevel -> unit
public: void WriteAsync(System::String ^ documentPath, System::Windows::Xps::XpsDocumentNotificationLevel notificationLevel);

Docs.param: The path of the source document.
An indication of whether notification is enabled.
Docs.summary: Writes asynchronously a specified XPS document with notification option to the target or .

remarks.format:
## Remarks When `notificationLevel` is disabled, the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter> copies the serialized XPS document to the target <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> that created the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter>. When `notificationLevel` is enabled, the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter> first deserializes the document, next reserializes it, and then writes it to the target with progress notifications as each page is output.
Although the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class has a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of multiple documents. This method adds the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements in the source to the sequence of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements in the target <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.
If `notificationLevel` is specified as <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentNotificationLevel.ReceiveNotificationEnabled>, notifications are produced only when the document is serialized, not printed. To receive notifications, the document must be reserialized. When a document is reserialized, all content from the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package> that's not required to be preserved by the [XML Paper Specification](https://www.ecma-international.org/publications-and-standards/standards/ecma-388/) is removed. The reserialization also removes all extensions from the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> markup, including any extended XPS content.
If `notificationLevel` is specified as <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentNotificationLevel.ReceiveNotificationDisabled> the document will not be reserialized and any extended content will be preserved, even when printed.
By design this <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WriteAsync%2A> method does not call the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WritingPrintTicketRequired> event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WriteAsync%2A> writes a set of documents asynchronously to the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> that created the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter>. The data that is written includes a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> and additional information that the caller wants to pass to an event handler.
Although the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class has a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of multiple documents. This method adds a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements to the existing sequence.
This method does not validate or modify the specified `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>. If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and is valid for a specified printer.

Docs.summary: Occurs just before a or method adds a to a document or print queue.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WritingPrintTicketRequired> enables an event handler to substitute a new <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> for the one that is passed to the write operation.
The following four <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.Write%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WriteAsync%2A> methods do not call the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WritingPrintTicketRequired> event:
- <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.Write%2A>(String)
- <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.Write%2A>(String, XpsDocumentNotificationLevel)
- <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WriteAsync%2A>(String)
- <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WriteAsync%2A>(String, XpsDocumentNotificationLevel)
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WritingPrintTicketRequired> event.
:::code language="csharp" source="~/snippets/csharp/System.Printing/LocalPrintServer/Overview/XpsPrintHelper.cs" id="Snippetprintmultiplefixedcontentdocuments"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsPrint/visualbasic/xpsprinthelper.vb" id="Snippetprintmultiplefixedcontentdocuments":::
The event handler is created in the following example.
:::code language="csharp" source="~/snippets/csharp/System.Printing/LocalPrintServer/Overview/XpsPrintHelper.cs" id="Snippetmultiplefixedcontentdocuments_writingprintticketrequired"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsPrint/visualbasic/xpsprinthelper.vb" id="Snippetmultiplefixedcontentdocuments_writingprintticketrequired":::

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to create and use a <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WritingProgressChanged> event handler.
:::code language="csharp" source="~/snippets/csharp/System.Windows.Documents/DocumentPaginator/PageSize/XpsSaveHelper.cs" id="Snippetwritingevents"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsSave/visualbasic/xpssavehelper.vb" id="Snippetwritingevents":::
